irobots.comm

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • lejos.robotics.navigation.Pose
      • irobots.comm.Robot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    lejos.robotics.Transmittable

    public class Robot
extends lejos.robotics.navigation.Pose
    This class contains information about a robot, like position, heading, and where it is moving.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Robot me
      This variable contains the information about the robot running the program.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Robot() 
      Robot(float x, float y, float heading)

        public static volatile Robot me
        This variable contains the information about the robot running the program.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Robot()

      • Robot

    • Method Detail

      • setFixedX

        public void setFixedX(float x)
        Sets the x-coordinate of the robot and marks it to be absolute. When both the x-coordinate and y-coordinate are marked as absolute the position of the robot is also marked as being absolute.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the robot

      • setFixedY

        public void setFixedY(float y)
        Sets the y-coordinate of the robot and marks it to be absolute. When both the x-coordinate and y-coordinate are marked as absolute the position of the robot is also marked as being absolute.
        Parameters:
        y - The y-coordinate of the robot

      • isPositionAbsolute

        public boolean isPositionAbsolute()
        Returns whether the position of the robot is absolute. If the robots position is absolute (0,0) is in the south-east corner of the field. If the position is not absolute (0,0) is at the starting position of the robot.

      • setPositionAbsolute

        public void setPositionAbsolute(boolean positionAbsolute)
        Sets if the postion of the robot is absolute.

      • meFromPose

        public static Robot meFromPose(lejos.robotics.navigation.Pose p)
        Creates a new robot from the position data provided by the given pose. Values not contained in the given pose are taken from Robot.me. This method is primarily intended to be used to update Robot.me with new information from the pose provider.
        Parameters:
        p - The pose to extract information from
        Returns:
        A robot instance corresponding to the position and heading in the given pose.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Returns the unique id of the robot.

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Sets the id of the robot.
